Package edu.ncsu.csc216.stp.model.manager

Class TestPlanManager

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.stp.model.manager.TestPlanManager
public class TestPlanManager extends Object
Concrete class which stores the Test Plans being worked on by the User, as well as the list of Failing Test Cases. This is the class which will be utilized by the GUI the most, as it handles all the fields and Strings seen by the User in the UI panel.
Author:
William Hazlehurst, Erik Svanes

  • Constructor Details

    • TestPlanManager

      public TestPlanManager()
      Constructor for the TestPlanManager singleton method. isChanged is set to false since this is the default list of TestPlans. The current TestPlan is the list of Failing Tests.

  • Method Details

    • loadTestPlans

      public void loadTestPlans(File testPlanFile)
      Method for loading a list of TestPlans from a specified file. This will set isChanged to true since the User has loaded a new list of TestPlans
      Parameters:
      testPlanFile - The File from which the TestPlans are being loaded

    • saveTestPlans

      public void saveTestPlans(File testPlanFile)
      Method for saving the current list of TestPlans to a specified file. This will set isChanged to false since the TestPlan has been saved
      Parameters:
      testPlanFile - The File which the list of TestPlans are being saved to

    • isChanged

      public boolean isChanged()
      Method for determining if the current state of the system has been changed
      Returns:
      Boolean of whether or not the state of the system has been changed

    • addTestPlan

      public void addTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Method for adding a Test Plan to the list of TestPlans
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - Name of the TestPlan being added
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the name is "Failing Tests" or a duplicate of another

    • getTestPlanNames

      public String[] getTestPlanNames()
      Returns a 1D array of Strings that list the TestPlan names. This is primarily used in the GUI to show the possible TestPlans a User can select to choose.
      Returns:
      1D array of Strings of the names of the TestPlans

    • setCurrentTestPlan

      public void setCurrentTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Method for setting the current TestPlan to whatever TestPlan the User has selected.
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - Name of the TestPlan the User has selected

    • getCurrentTestPlan

      public AbstractTestPlan getCurrentTestPlan()
      Returns the currently selected TestPlan as an AbstractTestPlan for the User to view.
      Returns:
      The currently selected TestPlan as an AbstractTestPlan

    • editTestPlan

      public void editTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Method for editing a TestPlan the User has selected.
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - Name of the TestPlan the User wants to edit
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the current TestPlan is the Failing Tests or if there the name is a duplicate of another

    • removeTestPlan

      public void removeTestPlan()
      Method for removing the currently selected TestPlan from the list of TestPlans
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When the User attempts to delete the Failing Tests list

    • addTestCase

      public void addTestCase(TestCase t)
      Method for adding a TestCase to the currently selected TestPlan
      Parameters:
      t - The TestCase being added to the currently selected TestPlan

    • addTestResult

      public void addTestResult(int idx, boolean passing, String actualResult)
      Method for adding a TestResult to the currently selected TestPlan given an index, status of passing, and actual results
      Parameters:
      idx - Index of the Test Result
      passing - Boolean value of whether the TestCase is passing or not
      actualResult - String of the Actual Results

    • clearTestPlans

      public void clearTestPlans()
      Method for clearing the failing test list of all Test Cases across all Test Plans
